intro: Neoalsomitra stephensiana, commonly known as the Stephens' neoalsomitra, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
